docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Terry McAuliffe, the longtime Democratic fund-raiser, has spent his first months in office hosting happy hours and breakfast meetings, but his fellow lawmakers complain that he has ignored the issues.

headline.main: Virginia Governor Finds Jollity Is No Guarantee Against Gridlock
headline.print_headline: Virginia Governor Finds Jollity Is No Guarantee Against Gridlock

docs.abstract: Virginia Gov Terry McAuliffe has found that his gift for persuasion is ineffective against conservative Republican majority in the House of Delegates; special legislative session is set to begin with both Democrats and Republicans raising the specter of a government shutdown over McAuliffe's desire to expand Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: Gov. Terry McAuliffe, the longtime Democratic fund-raiser, has spent his first months in office hosting happy hours and breakfast meetings, but his fellow lawmakers complain that he has ignored the issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Why must powerful women be judged and found wanting?
docs.abstract: Julia Baird Op-Ed article highlights book Censoring Queen Victoria: How Two Gentlemen Edited a Queen and Created an Icon by Yvonne M Ward; contends book shows how image of Victoria as a neglectful mother is largely a myth; holds, as so often happens with working mothers, focus is on their absence and not their affection.
docs.snippet: Why must powerful women be judged and found wanting?

docs.lead_paragraph: Alan Thacker wants health coverage, but he can't get help in his home state of Georgia. Mary Moscarello Gutierrez no longer can afford insurance in New Jersey. Justin Thompson of Utah refuses to be forced into the president's health law.

docs.lead_paragraph: FRIEDMAN--Herbert V.,born November 2, 1918, cherished husband of more than 70 years of Marion (nee Rosenfeld), adored father of Barbara Altman (Ron) and Ken (Joanne), beloved grandpa of Andrew Altman, Lynn Altman, Melissa Wolfson, and Jeff Wolfson, and superpappy of Hannah, Brent, and Jared Wolfson. After graduating from NYU, Heights in 1939 and Columbia Law School in 1942, Herb enlisted in the Army Air Corps. Following the war and the birth of their children, he and Marion made their home in Rockville Centre, NY, for 55 years, joining Central Synagogue of Nassau County and becoming founding members of Middle Bay Country Club in 1955. A lifetime member of the Million Dollar Round Table, Herb established an extraordinarily successful insurance business, specializing in association group and group health insurance. An avid golfer, Herb had six holes in one, scoring his last one at age 88. In addition to golf and a good gin game, Herb loved going out with Marion and family and friends, to enjoy a great meal, a good martini, and lots of laughs. All who knew him delighted in his upbeat personality, his joie de vivre, his warmth, and his sense of humor. His smile was magnificent and his laughter contagious. Services are private. In lieu of flowers, a donation to your favorite charity would be appreciated.
